title: Suzanne Zimmerman
text:
Suzanne Winona Zimmerman (July 13, 1925 – March 14, 2021), also known by her married name Suzanne Edwards, was an American competition <a href="swimming%20%28sport%29">swimmer</a> and Olympic medalist. At the <a href="1948%20Summer%20Olympics">1948 Summer Olympics</a> in London, Zimmerman won a silver medal in the <a href="Swimming%20at%20the%201948%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20100%20metre%20backstroke">100-meter backstroke</a>.
Zimmerman was born in <a href="Portland%2C%20Oregon">Portland, Oregon</a>. Growing up in Oregon, her swim coach was <a href="International%20Swimming%20Hall%20of%20Fame">International Swimming Hall of Fame</a> member <a href="Jack%20Cody">Jack Cody</a>. Along with fellow 1948 Olympians <a href="Brenda%20Helser">Brenda Helser</a> and <a href="Nancy%20Merki">Nancy Merki</a>, Zimmerman was part of the <a href="Multnomah%20Athletic%20Club">Multnomah Athletic Club</a> team dubbed "Cody's Kids" that from 1939 to 1948, won 58 individual national swimming titles and three national team swimming championships. She is a member of the <a href="Oregon%20Sports%20Hall%20of%20Fame">Oregon Sports Hall of Fame</a>.
